thread.title: Arsenal have won all 10 games this season without Coquelin | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Arsenal have won all 10 games this season without Coquelin | Daily Mail Online

author: James Dutton For Mailonline
title: Arsenal have won all 10 games this season without Coquelin | Daily Mail Online
text: Win percentage 100 The damning statistics show that it is hardly coincidental. When Coquelin is absent Arsenal average more goals per game and concede far fewer than when he features. An average of 2.2 goals for and 1.3 goals against jumps to 3 and drops to 0.4 when he does not play. Unfortunately for Arsenal fans, Wenger may have little choice but to play the midfield hex for the foreseeable future. Mohamed Elneny is on international duty, and also an injury doubt for when he returns, while Aaron Ramsey limped off after 20 minutes on Tuesday night with a calf strain. The Frenchman was seen as a key part of the squad when he broke into the first-team in 2015 Coquelin celebrates after Alex Iwobi reduced the deficit for Arsenal in the second-half Santi Cazorla is still recovering from ankle surgery and faces a lengthy spell on the sidelines, while Granit Xhaka is serving a four-game ban after picking up his second red card of the season in the 2-1 win over Burnley. In the 5-0 FA Cup win over Southampton on Saturday Wenger went with a midfield duo of teenager Ainsley Maitland-Niles and Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain. If Wenger takes Coquelin's worrying record seriously, he may be tempted to go with that unconventional duo more often. RELATED ARTICLES
